metadata.title: CVE-2024-49967 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ext4: no need to continue when the number of entries is 1

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-49967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-204-generic - 5.4.0-204.224~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-204-lowlatency - 5.4.0-204.224~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1159-kvm - 4.15.0-1159.164
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-aws - 4.15.0-1176.189
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1137-aws - 5.4.0-1137.147~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-gcp - 4.15.0-1169.186
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1141-gcp - 5.4.0-1141.150~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1084-ibm - 5.4.0-1084.89~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-oracle - 4.15.0-1138.149
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1136-oracle - 5.4.0-1136.145~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-232.244').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-204.224~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.164').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.189').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1137.147~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1184.199').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-1142.149~18.04.1').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.186').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gcp-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1141.150~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0').
linux-gke-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-gkeop-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1084.89~18.04.1').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.149').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.3').
linux-oracle-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.4').
linux-oracle-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1136.145~18.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-1121.133~18.04.1').
